skillTree.localised_description: As menial slaves to the Butcher's bidding, these Gnoblars must find him meat for the pot, or wind up in it themselves.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: It never hurts to keep your lucky Gnoblar with you, just in case.
Stumpy and short-witted as they are, these Gnoblars have an eye on the sky at all times.
Puny magicks are nothing in the face of the Great Maw's endless hunger.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the bell sounds, it's snack time for the assembled host. Then, the carnage can begin again, on a full stomach, with all of the associated drawbacks!
The Slaughtermaster speaks as the Great Maw wills, and all of the faithful listen well.
"Kill a creature with poison and it seeps into their skin – gives that yummy flesh an extra kick!"

effects.description:
Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Covered head to foot in (someone else's) bodily effluvia, stinking to the heavens, yet very much a conduit for the Great Maw's insatiable hunger and thirst, and the horrific violence that inevitably follows.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -10% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: The reeking odour seeping from this one's every pore would offend any creature with a nose, and several without.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Regular consumption of rotten meat and toxins are the staples of a healthy Ogre diet.
"Fetch me more bones! This meal could use a little crunch!"
More flesh for the feasting means more punishing magic for Skrag's foolish enemies!

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Once the slaughter begins, every foe is but meat yet to be carved.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
Where this one goes, his meat-pot goes too, as a bounteous reserve for his spells.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When an Ogre charges, the ground itself begins to quake. As it should.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +8 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Ogre Bulls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though their intelligence is as pitiful as their physique, one would be a fool not to fear the Gnoblars when massed in numbers.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +3 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Gnoblars and Pigback Riders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If there's one thing more horrifying than being rushed by a hulking, bloodthirsty beast, it's being rushed by that same creature riding on the back of another equally hulking, bloodthirsty beast.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Mournfang Cavalry and Crushers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Ogres' true firepower is as destructive and indelicate as the Ogres themselves.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +12% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblaster units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even ferocious brutes like the Ironguts and Maneaters fight harder in the presence of a worthy leader.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Ironguts and Maneaters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: What the monstrous creatures of the mountains lack in guile, they more than make up for in their stubborn reluctance to die.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +4 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Sabretusk Pack, Blood Vultures, Yhetees, Thundertusk, Stonehorn, Gorgers and Giant units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the most brutal, vicious killer go the richest spoils.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Ironguts, Gnoblars, Pigback Riders and Ogre Bulls units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When pelting a helpless enemy with heavy projectiles is so much fun, why bother stopping?

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +15% for Gnoblar Trappers, Leadbelchers, Gnoblar Scraplauncher and Ironblasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When fearsome, brute strength is combined with terrifying speed, the petty weaklings among the enemy can only wet themselves in fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +7 for Mournfang Cavalry, Crushers, Stonehorn, Blood Vultures, Thundertusk and Sabretusk Pack units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Driven by ravenous hunger, the Maneaters feast on the flesh of the fallen.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +7 for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Maneaters, Gorgers, Yhetees and Giant units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +5%
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%
	(Lord's army)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +15%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ogres flock to this Butcher's camp, eager for the chance to witness the Great Maw's malevolent power.
Even Ogres are capable of forward planning, especially when it comes to precious loot.
This ravening Ogre Lord is but a mere symbol of his god, whose cancerous power reigns over the Mountains of Mourn.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The grumblings of unrest tend to quiet when under threat of being crushed and eaten.
The mysterious powers of the Great Maw can heal even the deepest of wounds.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Greatly reduced chance of being detected while in ambush stance

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

Missile strength: +10% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab or gouge, it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Butchery is an art. This one knows how to extract every last morsel worth eating from a carcass, leaving only bones behind them.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Though they risk killing the Ogres directly behind them, those fighters who like it spicy can propel themselves further with gassy emanations following a hearty meal.

effects.description:
Leadership: -2 for enemy units
	(enemy armies in local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The more meat you eat, the stronger and fatter you become, and therefore the harder you are to move from your chosen position.
There may or may not be a height difference between this one and his Ogreish colleagues, but in stature on the battlefield the divergence is most stark.
"Remember, lads, when Great Maw came 'e ate the night, shook the ground and burnt it with fire. That is 'oo we serve, not sum uvver power."
